comments:
OCL syntax helper triggers a NullPointerException  when one of the typed element
is undefined.

The syntax helper should handle this more gracefully, probably by showing some kind of "(untyped)" string or such.

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.ocl.uml.UMLReflectionImpl.getDescription(UMLReflectionImpl.java:92)
Tentatively scheduling for 1.2 release because this adds a new translatable string and is somewhat of a fringe scenario (in which there would be no feasible completions anyway).
Fix is committed to CVS HEAD (1.2 branch).
Fixed in the MDT OCL 1.2.0 I200710171533 build.
